feed.title: Google Cloud: Memorystore for Memcached
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Memorystore for Memcached

entry.content: Memorystore for Memcached is being deprecated and will be shut down on January 31, 2029. After February 1, 2027, you can't create Memorystore for Memcached instances in new projects unless these instances already exist in these projects. We recommend that you migrate your workloads to Memorystore for Valkey, which offers superior performance and features.
entry.summary: Memorystore for Memcached is scheduled for deprecation, with full shutdown on January 31, 2029. Instance creation will be restricted in new projects starting February 1, 2027. Users are advised to migrate to Memorystore for Valkey.
entry.title: Deprecated: Memorystore for Memcached deprecation

entry.content: You can now use Cloud Logging to query and view maintenance logs for a Memorystore for Memcached instance. For more information, see View maintenance logs. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.summary: View maintenance logs for your Memorystore for Memcached instances using Cloud Logging. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Cloud Logging for Memorystore for Memcached maintenance logs
